message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest acute sinusitis, and among the options, viral infection is the most common risk factor for the development of sinusitis. Other risk factors include allergies and anatomical abnormalities of the nose and sinuses. While asthma, diabetes mellitus, and tobacco use can increase the risk of respiratory infections, they are not specific risk factors for sinusitis.
